children.subject: +1, following. I have taken 188 and am taking 189 right now.

history.content:
Hopefully someone else will be able to answer better than me. I started taking it last semester but quickly had to drop it due to other obligations. From what I saw (I was actually fortunate enough to teach a discussion section in the same room as AHRI right after it, so I got to see what a lot of the material was throughout the semester), assuming you have basic proficiency in AI/Reinforcement Learning/Machine Learning, maturity in statistics and optimization would probably be the most important.

Pretty sure you need at least an A in 188 and 189 or something significant in order for Anca to let you into the class.

Hopefully someone else will be able to answer better than me. I started taking it last semester but quickly had to drop it due to other obligations. From what I saw (I was actually fortunate enough to teach a discussion section in the same room as AHRI right after it, so I got to see what a lot of the material was throughout the semester), assuming you have basic proficiency in AI/Reinforcement Learning/Machine Learning, maturity in statistics and optimization would probably be the most important.

Does anyone here have experience with Prof. Dragan's Algorithmic Human-Robot Interaction course? I know it has no official prerequisites, but I wanted to know what kind of prep would be sufficient for this course? Could I still do fine in it if, say, I'm taking it concurrently with CS188, but haven't had any real prior AI experience yet?
history.subject: CS 294- Algorithmic HRI
